channel.title: What would I need
channel.description: Ive been thinking of making a image/file uploading place. like rapidshare,or megaupload. Or something along the line of upit.be. What would I need to make something like these.?

item.title: What would I need
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

nope. any OS will do, because XAMPP is made for multi-platforms. I suggest using Linux anyway, and else windows if you’re a noob at linux

item.title: What would I need
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

Lots of hosting companies don’t support uploading directories because they take too much space and bandwidth. It would slow down their servers. How many websites do you currently have?

Read full topic

item.title: What would I need
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

Depends what you’re file size limit would be, and will it be just images? Or any file?

Either way, if it gets traffic, we’re talking hundreds of GBs, possibly TBs… If you planned on using free hosting, forget it lol.

Read full topic

item.title: What would I need
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

Here’s an image uploading script I made awhile back:

[code=html]


[/code]

Result.php

<?php

                        $yoursite = "";        
                        $uploaddir = "";
                        $uploadfile = $uploaddir . basename(str_replace(" ", "", $_FILES['userfile']['name']));

                        $ext = explode(".", $_FILES['userfile']['name']);
                        $ext = array_pop($ext);
                        $ext = strtolower($ext);

                        $fna = explode(".", $_FILES['userfile']['name']);
                        $filename = $fna[0];
                        $origfilename = $filename;

                        $fileType = $_FILES['userfile']['type'];

                        $i = 1;


                        if ($ext == "jpeg" || $ext == "png" || $ext == "jpg" || $ext == "gif")
                            {
                            if ($fileType == "image/gif" || $fileType == "image/pjpeg" || $fileType == "image/x-png" || $fileType == "image/jpeg" || $fileType == "image/png")
                                {
                                while (file_exists( $uploadfile )) 
                                    {
                                    $filename = $origfilename;
                                    $newfilename = $filename. $i . "." .$ext;
                                    $uploadfile = $uploaddir . $newfilename;
                                    $i++;
                                    }

                                if (move_uploaded_file($_FILES['userfile']['tmp_name'], $uploadfile))
                                    {
                                    echo "<img src=".$uploadfile." width='0' height='0'>" .
                                            "<p>File uploaded <font color=green><b>successfully!</b></font>" .
                                            "<br /> " .
                                            "<br /><input type='text' onClick='select(this);' style='width: 420px' size='70' value='[url=$yoursite][img]" . $yoursite .substr($uploadfile, 1) . "[/img][/url]' /> Hotlink for forums<br />" .
                                            "<br /><input type='text' onClick='select(this);' style='width: 420px' size='70' value='<a href=" . $yoursite . "><img src=" . $yoursite .substr($uploadfile, 1) . "></a>' /> Hotlink for websites<br />" .
                                            "<br /><input type='text' onClick='select(this);' style='width: 420px' size='70' value='" . $yoursite . substr($uploadfile, 1) . "' /> Direct Link to image";
                                    } 
                                else 
                                    {
                                    echo "File <font color=red><b>failed</b></font> to upload, no upload specified, unsupported extension, or file too big.";
                                    }
                                }
                            else
                                {
                                echo "File <font color=red><b>failed</b></font> to upload, no upload specified, unsupported extension, or file too big.";
                                }
                            }
                        else
                            {
                            echo "File <font color=red><b>failed</b></font> to upload, no upload specified, unsupported extension, or file too big.";
                            }
                    ?>

I wouldn’t recommend making a site like that unless you have a lot of space and bandwidth… I mean A LOT.

Read full topic
